title: RuntimeError: Can't have size-dependent arguments to functions that take variable number of tensor arguments
body_html:
pytorch to onnx:
when do convert torch.onnx.export(torch_model, (dummy_input1, dummy_input2), "lmmodel.onnx", verbose=True, input_names=input_names, output_names=output_names)
cause an error:

File "/home/yunxiawang/codes/torch2onnx/nce.py", line 96, in forward
    self.noise[target.data.view(-1)].view_as(target)
RuntimeError: Can't have size-dependent arguments to functions that take variable number of tensor arguments

python 3.6,
pytorch 0.4.1,
onnx 1.3.0,
all installed by pip.

body:
pytorch to onnx:
when do convert `torch.onnx.export(torch_model, (dummy_input1, dummy_input2), "lmmodel.onnx", verbose=True, input_names=input_names, output_names=output_names)`
cause an error:
```
File "/home/yunxiawang/codes/torch2onnx/nce.py", line 96, in forward
    self.noise[target.data.view(-1)].view_as(target)
RuntimeError: Can't have size-dependent arguments to functions that take variable number of tensor arguments
```
python 3.6,
pytorch 0.4.1,
onnx 1.3.0,
all installed by pip.
